annotation: his father'; av? 'my father', tɔvɔm 'your father'
Polite respectful way to express the notion of "father". It tends to be replaced by papa brrowed from french.

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect

annotation: term of reference (ta = personal name marker)

language: Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia
Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: as written; y could be ŋ
as written; y could be ŋ
Parent who cares well for children; parents generally (Tgr)
as written; bama could be ba ma
Father, uncle, person in a fatherly relationship (Crl)
3SG form is <e>ma; other person-numbers inflect using root ama-
